means: 正式宣布（某人）为圣徒( canonize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Joan of Arc was finally canonized by Pope Benedict XV in 1920.
sentence.Network_cn: 圣女贞德终于在1920年由教皇本尼狄克十五世封为圣徒。

sentence.Network_en: Some reputed saints that have been canonized ought to have been cannonaded.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些被列为“圣徒”的驰名的圣人,早就应该被炮轰掉的.

sentence.Network_en: The pope had canonized her on April 30, 2000.
sentence.Network_cn: 教宗在二○○○年四月三十日册封她为圣人.

entry.tran: (在天主教中）封（死者）为圣徒,封圣
entry.def: If a dead person is canonized, it is officially announced by the Catholic Church that he or she is a saint.

example.ex: Joan of Arc was finally canonized by Pope Benedict XV in 1920.
example.tran: 圣女贞德终于在1920年由教皇本尼狄克十五世封为圣徒。
